page.title: 12Attitudes in Yewdale
page.content: The impact of{tourism}on the landscape probably arouses the greatest conflict in attitudes within the area. On the one hand, the tourists are needed to bring in the additional income that is so important to many families: on the other, tourists can damage fences and walls, let their dogs loose amongst sheep, leave litter, park cars dangerously, and by their sheer numbers wear out the footpaths on the fells. The{National Trust,}as a very large landowner, is rightly regarded by many people as having an enlightened attitude towards its tenants. However, some restrictions imposed by the Trust are considered irksome by numbers of local people. As always, there is a difficult balance between the needs of a working environment and those of a {National Park.
